snippet.textDisplay: I played this game in the PS3 era as PSOne classic. Neat controls and nice stage design and music. Overall the game provides a satisfying experience. Highly recommended!
snippet.textOriginal: I played this game in the PS3 era as PSOne classic. Neat controls and nice stage design and music. Overall the game provides a satisfying experience. Highly recommended!

snippet.textDisplay: This is going to sound really wierd, but this song always makes me think of Star Wars 7. Its the part with the bells that does it. It calls to my mind images of heroism, powerful emotions and otherworldly vistas.

snippet.textDisplay: So nostalgic. Every time I hear this, it brings me back to when I was younger playing this for the Wii back with my family, I remember we used to have fun and see who could beat which level first. It makes me sad, but in a good way. It's hard to explain why I feel that way. But I just miss it.😥
snippet.textOriginal: So nostalgic. Every time I hear this, it brings me back to when I was younger playing this for the Wii back with my family, I remember we used to have fun and see who could beat which level first. It makes me sad, but in a good way. It's hard to explain why I feel that way. But I just miss it.😥

snippet.textDisplay: This game was unbelievably fun to just pick up and play, the controls were quite generous/simple to learn and I thought their vocalizations during narrating were absolutely hilarious.  It was incoherant nonsense, but very amusing.
snippet.textOriginal: This game was unbelievably fun to just pick up and play, the controls were quite generous/simple to learn and I thought their vocalizations during narrating were absolutely hilarious.  It was incoherant nonsense, but very amusing.

snippet.textDisplay: This track for me captures the heart of the PlayStation, in general. That era of gaming that was so new at the time and yet so professional in its game-making. The music was superb and exquisite like this. It had to be. PlayStation literally made a name for itself with exclusive titles, like Klonoa. Hopefully that trend will never die. The innovation of Sony impresses me even to this day.
snippet.textOriginal: This track for me captures the heart of the PlayStation, in general. That era of gaming that was so new at the time and yet so professional in its game-making. The music was superb and exquisite like this. It had to be. PlayStation literally made a name for itself with exclusive titles, like Klonoa. Hopefully that trend will never die. The innovation of Sony impresses me even to this day.

snippet.textDisplay:
Beautiful, brought tears to my eyes, lots of memories from when I was little & I also remember my mother crying over the ending to this game, but unfortunetly it has been 7 years since she passed away.

R.I.P Mother, I will always love you, my heart beats for you in this track.
snippet.textOriginal:
Beautiful, brought tears to my eyes, lots of memories from when I was little & I also remember my mother crying over the ending to this game, but unfortunetly it has been 7 years since she passed away.

R.I.P Mother, I will always love you, my heart beats for you in this track.

snippet.textDisplay: @TheTKC I quite liked the wii version, it lives up to the original quite well so long as you turn the english voices off. It's not that the voices are bad so much as you get more charm out of the phantomilian voices. It's also fairly cheap, especially compared to the original. I think I saw Klonoa for the PSX going for around 100 dollars but I got my wii one new for 30 bucks. I'd say it's a steal.
snippet.textOriginal: @TheTKC I quite liked the wii version, it lives up to the original quite well so long as you turn the english voices off. It's not that the voices are bad so much as you get more charm out of the phantomilian voices. It's also fairly cheap, especially compared to the original. I think I saw Klonoa for the PSX going for around 100 dollars but I got my wii one new for 30 bucks. I'd say it's a steal.

snippet.textDisplay: Finished this game again in one sitting yesterday, I hadn't played it since its release so I needed to refresh my memories. It's still a really fun game so it aged very well. I remember the ending making me sad back then and I know I wasn't alone! This song really stood out for me yesterday (especially when 1:42 hit), it's very chill/dreamy and you know you're near the end. The first half of the song takes place inside the tower and the other half outside, with less instruments and more ambient.
snippet.textOriginal: Finished this game again in one sitting yesterday, I hadn't played it since its release so I needed to refresh my memories. It's still a really fun game so it aged very well. I remember the ending making me sad back then and I know I wasn't alone! This song really stood out for me yesterday (especially when 1:42 hit), it's very chill/dreamy and you know you're near the end. The first half of the song takes place inside the tower and the other half outside, with less instruments and more ambient.
